intro: Helipterum variegatum, commonly known as the variable helipterum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal regions. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, with a distinctive central disk surrounded by ray florets. Helipterum variegatum is an herbaceous perennial that is adapted to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments.
